Review: This product is just amazing.  No more flying picks :).  I have already recommended to my entourage and the response has been great.  Just a great idea at a great price, even in Canadian dollars.  And Customer service is no. 1 as well. Thanks.

Name: James Franklin
Title: Love ‚Äòem!
Review: Love 'em!  I have used this product for a year now, and now I RARELY drop a pick. This product certainly builds my confidence on stage. No more dropping a pick right in the middle of that killer bend or KILLER riff in the middle of the KILLER solo!  :)

Name: John Mason
Title: Monster Grips are the best invention since the wheel.
Review: Monster Grips are the best invention since the wheel. They do exactly as advertised. If you buy these you will "never" drop another pick while playing, either picking or strumming. One word describes them the best - AWESOME. Every guitar player should have them on their favourite picks.

Name: Tattoo Matt
Title: I have always had issues holding into picks.
Review: I have always had issues holding into picks. I prefer smaller picks for their feel but it causes increasing problems with holding into them. Monster Grips provide a simple yet successful solution to help retain control. I have used products over the wars that leave fingers feeling tacky and just downright aren't worth the trouble. Monster Grips fills a gap in an industry and profession that has been needed and there is finally an answer to the problem of the "soap bar" pick.

Name: Linda
Title: Highly recommend to any guitar player.
Review: Still a great product makes using those smooth unusable picks finally useful.  Plus great for ensuring my thumb stays in the correct location when practicing. I would highly recommend to any guitar player or musician who needs a better grip.

Name: Andy
Title: Most wonderfully helpful thing I've bought in years.
Review: There are so many gimmicks, fads and essentially useless products in the music biz.  These are not.  Monsters are the smallest, cheapest, and most wonderfully helpful thing I've bought in years.  I also found there's no 'getting used to it' time.  Within seconds, they feel completely normal, and I now can't imagine using a pick which doesn't 'stick' to my fingers immediately.  The 16-pack is great too.  I cycle 4 picks, so with one monster each side, I still have half a pack left for the future.  5* Plus.  Great innovation guys.

Name: aa.werner
Title: Great product with endless uses.
Review: These Monster Grips work great for holding on to my pick.  Not only that, but I use them on my Snark Tuner because the ones I bought were made of slippery plastic.  Now that I've put Monster Grips on them they stay in my hand fine instead of slipping out.  Great product with endless uses.

Name: Colin Larson
Title: This product is simply AWESOME!!!
Review: I've been trying everything under the sun for years to help me get a better grip on picks (Glue Dots, Velcro Circles, Sandpaper, Rubber Washers, Rubber Bumber Pads, Skateboard Tape, Corkboard Circle Pads, Felt Circle Pads, Double Stick Tape, Putty, etc.) and none of these have been effective like Monster Grips. This product is simply AWESOME!!! The size, material and thickness is perfect and can be used on any kind of pick shape and material (tortex, celluloid, polycarbonate, delrin, ultex, etc.). For all you shredders out there like myself, I find I have better control now with Monster Grips than I did with all the other stuff I tried putting on my picks. One important key is that even though some of the other stuff I used in the past helped a bit with pick slippage, they felt uncomfortable. Monster Grips not only work the best, but they are comfortable and FEEL the best!!!!!

Name: Tim R.
Title: Highly recommended!
Review: Highly recommended! I like Dunlop Jazz III picks, which are easily grippable. So when I got custom (smooth) Jazz III-sized picks with my band's logo on them I found myself gripping the living hell out of them which caused my hand to ache. I had these picks that I paid a lot of money to have made but they were essentially unusable. So I bought Monster Grips and some of that tacky goo stuff. The tacky goo stuff is terrible. Sure you can grip your pick better but now your fingers are sticky (and it's a pain to wash off) AND your stick is picky. Or the other way around. Monster Grips were perfect. I put them slightly off-center on the non-logo side of my picks and play with my thumb on the Monster Grip. It made my unplayable picks usable again.

Name: Brian
Title: Thanks for a great product
Review: So ‚Ä¶ Read the review in September 2014 issue of Guitar Player magazine ‚Ä¶ "Hmm," thinks I, "is this just another way for me to give away my hard-earned cash?" Read it it a couple more times, watched the YouTube video, but still not convinced. Why? Last year I switched to using Dunlop "Big Stubby" 3mm picks, which have a pronounced textured dish on each side. "Well, how's that going to stick?" I wondered. And yet, and yet ‚Ä¶ Finally I emailed the good folks at Monster Grips to see what they suggested‚Äî"Yeah, like I'm gonna hear back any time soon," I thought. Within two hours I heard back!! "Yes, they do work, that's the pick I use myself," came the answer. I bought a set, which arrived in less than three days, and after getting used to them (one on each side), I've been recommending them to every guitar player I know. Thanks for a great product‚Äînow I have to live up to it!!

Name: Clark
Title: They really do work just as advertised.
Review: I've been playing the guitar since I was a teenager and I'm a senior adult now and I have NEVER found a pick I could hold on to until I found the Monster Grips.  They really do work just as advertised.  You can actually hold on to the pick.  I also like the way they play.......Great addition for guitar pickers....thanks

Name: John
Title: Great invention!
Review: You beautie!  They work perfectly at keeping my pick in place.  I suspect as I get older the sensitivity of my fingers is a little less and so I suffered from the pick moving position between my fingers all the time.  I even use them on picks which already have a textured surface, and the improvement is amazing. They are also great for increasing the thickness of the grip part of the pick, whilst keeping the flexibility of the pick itself so my tone sounds the same, but playability is very much improved. Great invention! Thanks a lot.

Name: Ariel
Title: Strongly suggest to try this grip.
Review: Im 52 years old and a complete rookie, i found the right guitar for a beginner, but I could never feel comfortable with all the picks that I tried, thanks that I saw an advertising on Guitar Player Magazine and I tried them, if you are a newbie, I strongly suggest to try this grip, I put one on each side of the pick, and now I don't need to even look my hand, strongly recommended

Name: Lenny
Title: I'll be ordering more!
Review: It took me years to find the right pick for my playing style.  The Dunlop Ultrex .73 Sharp picks feel perfect to me, but come winter they are really hard to hold onto with the dry winter air and the dry skin that comes with it.   I have to switch to a 'grippier' pick during the winter, but it's just not the same.  Now with Monster Grips, I can use my favorite picks in any situation or season and not worry about dropping them.   Thanks for solving my problem, Monster Grips - I'll be ordering more!

Name: dan
Title: I really like this product.
Review: I really like this product. The thumb-facing side is grippy without being sticky. It is a pliable silcone-like plastic with bumps that nicely grab your finger. The pick-facing side has a clear adhesive that does not ooze or attract lint or dirt. The adhesive is pretty much permanent as I have not had any grips peel or slip off the pick. You can put Monster Grips on one side of the pick for a mild grip or put them on both side for a monster death grip.

Name: HizLady
Title: The whole world just became available to me.
Review: Let Your Music Monster out of the Closet:  Stop Fighting Your Pick ‚Äì Just Get A Grip! There are so many choices for picks ‚Äì a variety of materials from celluloid and nylon to shell and exotic woods.  I love to experiment with different picks.  There is something amazing about walking along the beach and finding an oyster shell that the waves and wind carved into the perfect guitar pick and then to hear it played on stage creating musical euphoria for all who hear its song.  Yet‚Ä¶ One thing stands in the way.  Shell and rosewood picks can be slippery and hard to hold. That perfect pick that sounds great, can only be brought to life as long as you can keep a hold of it!!!!  I have a large pick holder attached to my iPad (microphone) stand just for that reason.  I use to hold two of every style/type of pick so when one hits the ground, I can quickly grab another similar pick without changing the sound.   Life changed several months ago when this little kickstarter project developed a product that would let me hold any pick I want! Instead of having to buy a grip pick or one with sandpaper or a stupid little star hole ‚Äì I can now easily, effectively, and without any damage to the material ‚Äì grip my pick! A small textured adhesive patch can be placed in the exact ‚Äòsweet spot‚Äô of any pick, customized to my preferred grip.  The whole world just became available to me‚Ä¶ no material is safe from being carved or repurposed to become a music making piece of art!  Best of all, the patch is removable and never leaves a residue or damages my highly prized exotic picks!  I design my picks with dual grips, thumb side a little higher ‚Äì providing every pick the customization of being perfectly designed just for me!   When I‚Äôm done strumming and I want to finger pick for a verse, the grip can double as a static holder, keeping my pick secured to the front of my Martin guitar and ready for the chorus.  In an instant I can change from finger picking back to strumming with my pick without having to reach to the pick holder on my stand ‚Äì instead just brushing my hand across the surface of my guitar‚Ä¶ the static releases and the pick is effortlessly in my hand and I‚Äôm strumming again!  This adds a huge dimension to my music (and nothing left behind on my guitar!).   Remember my pick holder on my iPad stand? Well, it holds a variety of picks now.  No more duplicates!!!  Now I can have so many more options of materials and thus sounds, at my finger tips.  Creatively ‚Äì an amazing adventure! Let your music monster out of the closet ‚Äì stop fighting your pick ‚Äì just get a grip, a monster grip!

Name: Arthur kerevan
Title: Would purchase again.
Review: Saw these in a mag.thought what an idea.but do they work.oh yes.makes plecs feel very secure and would purchase again.thanks.

Name: Howard
Title: Thanks to Monster Grips
Review: Before Monster Grips, I could be counted on to drop at least two picks per set, causing humiliation and cacophonic musical train wrecks, and worst of all - driving all the girls away. But now, they chase me after every set, begging to know how I keep my picks from flying about like tiny missiles. Thanks to Monster Grips, my love life has never been better. I'm still a crappy guitar player though.

Name: Denny
Title: THESE THINGS REALLY WORK!
Review: I am a creative guy.... I have melted, etched, punched holes, put adhesive backed sand paper onto my picks in the fervent hopes of keeping them from slipping from my fingers. My hands are VERY dry, limiting my gripping power on those slick little plastic devils. I have also bought picks with etched grips, dished out grips and various other built in grip improvements. ABJECT FAILURE ! UNTIL NOW !!!!! I admit, I was skeptical. Having made my own, ingenious (non) solutions, and bought many other "improved" models... REALLY, what could these people have done that was any better than what I had already tried ?????   I'm here to tell you, THESE THINGS REALLY WORK ! If, like me, you have slippery fingers  BUY MONSTER GRIPS  Such a small price for such a major improvement. Now, if I can only get my cheap brother to stop stealing my picks and buy his own MONSTER GRIPS.

Name: Preppy
Title: I absolutely love these
Review: I realize I'm fairly new to guitar, but I absolutely love these. I got my guitar teacher on the bandwagon too!

Name: Reginald
Title: Thanks for the fine product!
Review: What a great idea.  I like the feel!  It allows for a secure grip without having to squeeze the bejesus out of my picks.  I like to use some different materials like horn or bone but sometimes they're too hard to hold on to.  If I'm worried about my grip, I find it hard to keep my wrist loose. your little dots of grippiness make it so much easier to hold the pick with less tension in my fingers and wrist.  Less afraid of pitching the pick across the room.  Thanks for the fine product! Reg

Name: Dean
Title: Really improved my playing.
Review: Great product!  As a beginning guitarist, these grips allow for a much looser grip on the pick which in turn helps when trying to mix up the speed of strumming - particularly when trying to execute a double strum within a normal 8th note strumming pattern.  Without the grips, the pick simply rotates too much during the strumming.  Really improved my playing.

Name: Linda
Title: I would highly recommend these to anyone.
Review: i started learning guitar over a year ago and finding the correct pick has difficult, monster grips has meant any pick is now correct. I showed to my music tutor who said the saxophone players and also had uses for these as well as the fastest guitarists covering Spanish flamenco and quick paced material. I would highly recommend these to anyone. These have been a great purchase.

Name: Santiago
Title: A great buy
Review: The "real deal."  I've been playing for a long time and have always preferred small jazz picks.  Have jumped around from pick to pick and the problem of sweaty hands and slipping picks has plagued me for quite some time, especially during the jitters of playing live (yes, I get those too).  Ordered these bad boys to"try" them out.  Whoa!  All I can say is, they are the "real deal."  No more slippage.  They allow the guitar pick stick to my picking fingers like none other pick has allowed me to do so before.  The very cool thing is being able to use them on any pick.  A great buy.  You'll be glad you did it, I sure am.

Name: Rich
Title: This is a must-have item
Review: Bought a couple packs a few weeks ago, anticipating using more than 16.  Wrong, gonna need more than 32.  Renewed acquaintance with a bunch of picks of varying stiffness relegated to the bottom of guitar case.  I can now use the standard picks which were really slippery.  For me, need to use 1 grip per side, so they go fast.  Experimented using 3 on a pick, this works for us who hold the pick really loose and allows changing (sometimes deliberately) the position.  (Never said I am a consistent guitarist.)  Was using picks with some texture but was dropping those also...  This is a must-have item, one can't go wrong.  Wanted to provide a comment sooner after trying out different picks, but have been too busy practicing

Name: John Gazda
Title: Better than i had hoped for!
Review: Its about time! i have been a victim as well as a winner in the past buying different ‚Äústuff‚Äù for my guitars and amps! Hands down this is the best idea i have yet to experience in my years playing. No downside, in fact these little beauties work better than i had hoped for! Go figure, minimal investment, maximum functionality! You have a solid customer here! I never go on line and rave, but this time‚Ä¶.. :) Kudos to a great idea, John Gazda

Name: Eric C
Title: I am very satisfied
Review: I am by no means an expert guitar player but I enjoy learning songs in my free time and I would occasionally have issues with dropping my pick. The great thing about Monster Grips is that you don't really notice them while you're playing. You'll be on your guitar for an hour only to realize "wow, i never once came close to dropping my pick." It's at that moment that you realize what a great product this is. I am very satisfied and would recommend to any guitar player, regardless of experience.

Name: Bill Cormier
Title: Very pleased.
Review: Absolutely great product!!  I've tried everything: drilled holes, double sided tape, etc... Nothing worked like these little discs do. Had a four hour rehearsal over the weekend and started with another "bag" product over my pick and dropped it twice. Took off the bag and had forgotten I had Monster Grips on the pick as well. No more  problems!!  Very pleased. Bill C

Name: Jon.horrocks
Title: Much better than gorilla snot and the like.
Review: Just received my pack of grips here in the UK. What can I say - awesome!!!  Easy to use and does exactly what it says on the tin. Grippy but not sticky. Much better than gorilla snot and the like. Will definitely be getting some more.

Name: dennis
Title: Lovin' ,em!
Review: These little guys are great! I was worried they'd leave a film on my thumb, but not at all - lovin' ,em!

Name: Carl
Title: Love it.
Review: I have been using monster grips for about a week now and I have to say that I wish I invented these first! They are exactly what I have been looking for. I started by just adding it to one side of my pick but now I have it on both sides and it feels great. I also love the extra benefit of being able to stick my pick to the guitar when I'm done playing. It's not sticky at all yet it sticks to the guitar. How is that possible??? Love it.

Name: Salvatore
Title: Worth it
Review: Works great! Very satisfied with the product, worth it for your favorite pick!

Name: Sid E
Title: I wish this product was around when I started playing.
Review: Have you ever seen a the guitarist at a rock concert smash his sweet guitar at the end of a set? It's because he dropped his pick. I absolutely love this product. When I play hard I used to drop my pick or have to readjust it in the middle of a song. No more. The other thing I love is that it can stick to my guitar. I like to pluck and use a pick in the same song, and now I don't have to hold it in my mouth and sing. I just stick it to the edge where I can easily grab it. I wish this product was around when I started playing.

Name: Jon
Title: Excellent!
Review: Just received mine and they are exactly how I thought they would be. Excellent! Great grip and perfect for all occasions, especially those sweaty gigs where it ends up feeling hard to hold your pick. I would love for a whole SHEET of this product just so I could cut my own sizes, however, as I would want them to just be a bit bigger and my own custom shape for the way I hold my pick.

Name: David Bakker
Title: No more slipping!
Review: Don't even have a guitar, still love these things. Small little ultra grippy stickers for use on my phone and camera. No more slipping!

Name: TDJMB
Title: They work great on V-Picks.
Review: The Monster Grips are just as advertised.  I have a twitch & not too much grip strength in my picking hand - so they really help.  They work great on V-Picks.  I know V-Picks are known for already being "grippy" and the raised text on one side helps.  I put the Monster Grip on the other side and it really improved the grip and is not too thick.  They help on the black rubber triangular Herdim picks but, for those, I'd prefer a larger, triangular shape that would cover about half the pick & could be trimmed to size.  Maybe this could be a new model?

Name: Aaron
Title: I would recommend this over any other alternative
Review: I am definitely happy! It is really as it is described.  It adheres to your pick on the backside, but the front grip surface is clean and dry and stays that way. I would recommend this over any other alternative as far as "pick-additives" go.

Name: Josh
Title: I am a very satisfied customer.
Review: Hey, I just wanted to let you know that I received my Monster Grips yesterday. I have about four hours of use so far and I am a very satisfied customer. I wasn't sure how thick the pads would be, but they're very thin without sacrificing any grip at all! They're not sticky at all--just grippy in the perfect way. They're very comfortable, light, and perform exactly as I hoped they would. Congratulations on a great product!
